intro: Eriocaulon nudicuspe, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its reproductive structures are typically found in dense, compact inflorescences. Eriocaulon nudicuspe plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
